page.title: 04LAW AND ORDER IN INVERNESS
page.content: IN INVERNESS,{THE CASTLE AND THE {PRISON }ARE BOTH TO DO WITH {LAW AND {ORDER. THE CASTLE, }BUILT IN 1846,HAS THREE DIFFERENT COURT ROOMS. THEY ARE FOR THE HIGH,SHERIFF AND DISTRICT COURTS. ANY OFFENDER SENTENCED TO A TERM OF IMPRISONMENT BY ANY OF THESE COURTS WILL SERVE THE SENTENCE AT {PORTERFIELD PRISON, INVERNESS.}HERE A SINGLE CELL IS SHARED BY TWO CONVICTED MALE PRISONERS, WHILE A FEMALE PRISONER HAS A CELL TO HERSELF. THERE ARE 150 CELLS ALTOGETHER. SHORT TERM PRISONERS HAVE MORE RECREATION THAN LONG TERM PRISONERS. SOME TRUSTED PRISONERS ARE ALLOWED GARDENING. THE REAL TROUBLEMAKERS ARE SENT TO THE "CAGES". THESE ARE CELLS WITH BARS TO PROTECT OFFICERS FROM POSSIBLE ATTACK. A TYPICAL PRISONER'S DAY STARTS AT 6A.M.. HE WASHES, SHAVES AND HAS HIS BREAKFAST. A CONVICTED PRISONER EATS..
